name: Bhubalan Mani
title: Lead - Supply Chain Technology & Analytics
bio: Bhubalan brings deep expertise in supply chain technology and ERP systems optimization, currently serving as a lead in supply chain technology and analytics at Garmin. With a career spanning PwC, GE Appliances, and Deckers Brands, he specializes in designing end-to-end allocation processes, order management tools, and advanced supply chain analytics. He holds advanced degrees from Georgia Tech and Arizona State University.

name: Austin Swailes
title: Senior Project Manager - Supply Chain Business Systems
bio: Austin is a senior project manager at Garmin, bringing hands-on experience from one of the world's leading consumer electronics and GPS technology companies. His work at Garmin provides direct insight into how global consumer hardware brands manage product distribution, returns, and inventory across complex multi-channel ecosystems.

name: Edwin Heslinga
title: Global Reverse Logistics
bio: Edwin is an experienced reverse logistics and supply chain leader currently at ŌURA, the pioneering health wearables company. He previously held senior roles at Apple overseeing care operations, reverse logistics, 3PL management, and parts management, and prior to that at Microsoft. Edwin brings firsthand expertise in how top-tier consumer tech brands handle the full lifecycle of their products, from forward distribution to returns and recommerce.

name: Caleb Orion
title: Director of Digital Acquisition & Ecommerce
bio: Caleb is the Director of Digital Acquisition and eCommerce at Omnilux, where he leads performance marketing and digital sales strategy for a leading medical-grade LED skincare brand. He previously served as Director of Acquisition and Paid Media at Caden Lane and held senior performance marketing roles at Group Nine Media. Caleb holds an M.S. from Parsons School of Design and a B.A. from Reed College.

name: Chad Summe
title: Managing and Founding Partner
bio: Chad is the Co-Founder and Managing Partner of eGateway Capital, a growth-equity firm focused on the future of digital commerce. Prior to eGateway, he served as Chief Operating Officer and Chief Strategy Officer at Quotient Technology, where he led revenue, operations, and go-to-market strategy across a $225B CPG market. Earlier, he held brand management roles at Procter & Gamble and served as a Nuclear Submarine Officer in the U.S. Navy. Chad holds a B.S. in Economics from the U.S. Naval Academy and an MBA from Duke's Fuqua School of Business.

name: Kevin Gusweiler
title: Principal, Co-Founder
bio: Kevin is a Principal and Co-Founder of eGateway Capital, where he leads investment identification, deal execution, and portfolio company scaling. Prior to co-founding eGateway, he spent two years at Fort Washington Capital Partners managing private equity investments and held multiple leadership roles at Fifth Third Bank, most recently as VP of Corporate Development. Kevin holds a B.S. in Finance from Miami University.

name: Blake Patton
title: Managing Partner
bio: Blake is the Founder and Managing General Partner of Tech Square Ventures, an Atlanta-based early-stage venture capital firm that has backed more than 130 startups. He serves on the board of Nok Recommerce, alongside other portfolio companies. Previously, Blake was General Manager of Georgia Tech's ATDC—named by Forbes as one of the top incubators in the world—and held executive roles at iXL, helping scale it to over $400M in revenue and an IPO. He is a Professor of the Practice at Georgia Tech and holds a B.S. in Industrial and Systems Engineering from Georgia Tech.

name: Chris Shonk
title: Managing Director
bio: Chris is a Partner and Co-Founder of ATX Venture Partners, an Austin-based early-stage venture capital firm. A serial entrepreneur who started his first company at age fourteen, he was named the Special Operations Soldier of the Year during his military career. He co-founded Virtus Financial Group (now a $3.5B private equity fund), co-founded EZ Money Pawn, and co-founded Sneaky Games, which exited via IPO. Chris has been recognized as one of Austin's most influential leaders and holds an MBA from the Acton School of Business.

name: Xavier Facon
title: General Partner
bio: Xavier is the Executive-in-Residence at eGateway Capital and a recognized expert in ad-tech, retail media, AI, and advanced analytics. He previously served as Global Head of Retail Media at NielsenIQ and as SVP of Strategy and Media Technology at Quotient Technology. He is the founder of Crisp Media, which he guided through hypergrowth and a successful acquisition by Quotient Technology. With over 25 years of entrepreneurial and executive experience based in New York, Xavier holds degrees in Business and Computer Science from VIVES University.

name: Mike Weis
title: President
bio: Mike is a seasoned revenue and business development leader specializing in retail media and digital commerce. He currently serves as Senior Vice President of Business Development at Ansira and President of Contento2 LLC, focused on scaling technology companies in the Retail Media space. He previously held roles as Chief Revenue Officer at Venvee, Senior VP at Quotient Technology, and VP of Business Development at Catalina USA, and began his career in sales at Diageo and Unilever. Mike holds a B.S. in Business Marketing from San Jose State University.

name: Tylan Tschopp
title: Executive Vice President - Industrial Design & Innovation
bio: Tylan is the Executive Vice President of Industrial Design and Innovation at Westinghouse Electric Corporation. Prior to this role, he spent over a decade at Stanley Black & Decker, rising to Senior Director of Global Industrial Design, where he led global teams to redesign and reposition brands including BLACK+DECKER across 100+ product categories. Tylan brings a deep understanding of consumer product design, brand experience, and innovation strategy. He holds a B.S. in Industrial Design from The Ohio State University.

name: Maddy McIntyre
title: CEO
bio: Maddy brings a unique combination of leadership, business development, and sales as CEO of Nok. She served as Head of Partnerships at eGateway Capital and previously as Director of Business Development at InnoSource. Her career in athletics administration at The Ohio State University, where she founded and led the Eugene D. Smith Leadership Institute, shaped her expertise in building programs and forging strategic partnerships. A three-time captain of the OSU softball team and professional player in Italy, Maddy holds a bachelor's, master's, and MBA from Ohio State.

name: Nick Salgado
title: President
bio: Nick is the President of Nok, having previously served as VP of Finance at the company. He brings broad financial and operational experience from roles at Rappi, Homeward, The Wolff Company, The Vanguard Group, Envision Healthcare, and Merrill. Nick holds a CFA designation and a B.S. from Arizona State University, and has a demonstrated track record of scaling high-growth ventures through rigorous financial strategy and operational discipline.
